description:
If you’re passionate about helping people protect what matters most to them, as well as innovating and simplifying processes and operations to provide the best customer value, then Nationwide’s Property and Casualty team could be the place for you! At Nationwide®, “on your side” goes beyond just words. Our customers are at the center of everything we do and we’re looking for associates who are passionate about delivering extraordinary care.

A sign on bonus will be given to all external candidates hired into this role. The bonus is paid in the first pay period after 30 days of employment. 

Location: This position requires the associate works in our New York City office at a minimum two times per week.

The Ideal Candidate Will Have

Juris Doctor (JD) preferred.5-8 years of demonstrated experience navigating employment practices liability (EPL) claims.

Job Description Summary

The Excess Surplus (E&S) Claims team handles some of the most unique and interesting insurance claims at Nationwide. Many have complicated risks and loss history, requiring us to be adaptable and resilient in our work to help customers. If you love a challenge and can apply outstanding organizational, investigative and communication skills to your work, we want to hear from you!

As a Senior Claims Consultant, you'll investigate, evaluate and resolve complex claims of significant value. You'll provide direction to defense counsel handling lawsuits. We'll count on you to be a subject matter authority in a particular line of business or risk. In addition, you'll have opportunities to provide advice and counsel to E&S Claims leaders, insurance agents and internal business partners.

Job Description

Key Responsibilities: 

Handles, from inception to conclusion, the most serious and complex E&S claims. Settles or disposes of claims of significant value to the organization (e.g., risk exposure for individual policies in excess of $10 - 50 million; high limit excess, umbrella and unique risk with high limits – marine, aviation, director/officer, etc.).Identifies and manages reserves in compliance with company standards and practices. Recommends special reserves as necessary.Provides litigation strategies and consultation in partnership with defense counsel. Monitors litigation trends and practices to ensure that lawsuits are handled in a consistent fashion. Recommends changes to business leadership; provides implementation strategies and coordinates execution processes.Builds and maintains relationships with agents, brokers and product developers. Helps develop business plans to ensure claims quality results.Acts as Top level expert in product development and management for specialty lines of business. Provides standardized processes and claim handling expertise to new product development. Acts as top-level subject matter expert In specialty line claims. Identifies and develops training plans and strategies for the division. Provides niche training and consultation to non-claims areas.Provides top level consultation/direction to E&S Claims leaders, peers and other business partners about severe specialty claims issues, coverages or risks. Maintains current knowledge of multiple coverage lines, venue-specific court decisions which may impact the claim function, current guidelines and policy changes and modifications.May Manage associate performance, salary planning and administration, training and development, workflow and organizational planning, hiring and placement and disciplinary actions of contributing staff.

May Perform Other Responsibilities As Assigned.

Reporting Relationships: Reports to E&S Claims Director/Executive. May have up to three direct reports or serve as a project team leader.

Typical Skills And Experiences

Education: Undergraduate education in insurance, business, management, or related fields. Advanced degree preferred.

Completion of insurance courses such as IIA, AEI, or CPCU preferred.

License/Certification/Designation: Associates must acquire the required Federal and/or state licenses/registrations within the time period designated by the business unit. Additional licenses/registrations may be required when new products and services are implemented. If an associate fails to acquire required licenses/registrations within the designated time period, the associate will be ineligible to continue in the position.

Experience: Ten years prior insurance experience preferred. Demonstrated experience investigating and resolving complex coverage issues and litigated claims. Specific experience in a line of business preferred.

Knowledge, Abilities, and Skills: Deep knowledge of the best claims practices used to resolve the most severe claims. Demonstrated knowledge in a particular line of business and/or additional education may be required by the business unit (e.g., commercial/financial company, director and officer, ocean marine). High level of expertise relating to insurance contracts, coverage issues, contingent or extra-contractual liability against insurers and litigation management, both foreign and domestic. Sophisticated analytical skills to make independent decisions and resolve conflict in application of coverage to submitted claims, application of laws of jurisdiction to investigation facts, application of policy exclusions and exceptions. Confirmed ability to coordinate defense counsel handling cases involving serious and complex liability and damage issues from inception through trial. Exceptional oral and written communication skills when dealing with policyholders, claimants, attorneys, physicians and all levels of management. Organizational skills to effectively establish work priorities to meet objectives and standards. Demonstrated personal computer skills and the ability to operation claims and business software.

Other criteria, including leadership skills, competencies and experiences may take precedence.

Staffing exceptions to the above must be approved by the Vice President and HR Vice President.

Values: Regularly and consistently demonstrates the Nationwide Values.

Working Conditions

Overtime Eligibility: Not Eligible (Exempt)

Working Conditions: Normal office environment. Travel as necessary.

ADA: The above statements cover what are generally believed to be principal and essential functions of this job. Specific circumstances may allow or require some people assigned to the job to perform a somewhat different combination of duties.

Credit/Background Check: Due to the fiduciary accountabilities within this job, a valid credit check and/or background check will be required as part of the selection process.

Benefits

We have an array of benefits to fit your needs, including: medical/dental/vision, life insurance, short and long term disability coverage, paid time off with newly hired associates receiving a minimum of 18 days paid time off each full calendar year pro-rated quarterly based on hire date, nine paid holidays, 8 hours of Lifetime paid time off, 8 hours of Unity Day paid time off, 401(k) with company match, company-paid pension plan, business casual attire, and more. At EverCommerce [Nasdaq: EVCM], we are on a mission to digitally transform the service economy with tailored, end-to-end SaaS solutions that simplify and empower the lives of our 685,000+ customers. As a leading service commerce platform, our modern digital and mobile applications create predictable, informed, and convenient experiences between customers and their service professionals in the areas of Home & Field Services, Health Services, and Fitness & Wellness industries.

We are building an extraordinary company and looking for talented, energetic, and motivated people to join our team. You can learn more about our Company, Culture and Values here: https://careers.evercommerce.com/us/en

We are looking for a Project Manager II with our EverHealth brand to manage product development, product launch and other internal strategic and operational projects. Partnering with internal stakeholders across our organization and external stakeholders that include EHR partners, third party vendors and customers, you will shepherd multiple product launches, technology improvements and operational enhancement projects, while ensuring project goals, project schedule deadlines and stakeholder expectations are met.

EverHealth provides modern end-to-end solutions for healthcare providers. Our open, connected ecosystem of solutions and services helps providers engage patients, increase revenue, improve business efficiency, and remain market competitive. We serve 72,000 healthcare practices and counting.

You have a strong project management background and preferably experience in healthcare-related projects. Being very detail-oriented, you love building processes and plans to ensure that projects are executed successfully, meeting the intended goals. You are a self-starter that loves working with teams built across different areas in the organization such as engineering, QA, DevOps, marketing, sales, operations, product, onboarding and customer support. You love steering projects, striving to provide great satisfaction to both internal and external stakeholders. Having a servant leadership mindset and believing your job serves a purpose beyond just the paycheck, you love playing a key role in planning and facilitating organizational change and product delivery.

Responsibilities:

Manage multiple software development, solution integration, product launch and implementation services projects simultaneously. Collaborate to develop and successfully execute product launch project plans with product, engineering, DevOps, product, marketing, sales, onboarding, support and finance teams as well as third party vendors and EHR partners teams. Work with different internal and external stakeholders to establish comprehensive project plans with clear timeline, milestones and delivery expectations. Manage project schedules, scope, execution and overall organization to ensure deliverables and dates are clearly communicated, understood and executed upon. Facilitate cross-team orchestration, tracking and following up with internal and external dependencies. Monitor risks, issues and scope creep to foresee/identify potential problems and proactively identify resolutions to address them in advance. Conduct regular status meetings to track projects and communicate progress, issues and resolutions to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner. Produce and maintain project documentation, including statements of work, meeting notes, status reports, change management, additional project management tools and approvals. Ensure proper closure and handoffs on all projects managed. Other project management related tasks that may be identified as the organization grows. 

Requirements:

5+ years of experience planning and executing multiple software development, product launch and implementation projects simultaneously, both medium and large scale. Deep understanding of project and customer management and ability to discuss technical and business project requirements in detail when required. Excellent organizational, leadership, interpersonal and written and oral communication skillsGreat critical thinking, problem solving and analytical skills, ability to identify solutions and ensure progress in the face of obstacles. Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. Proven initiative and resourcefulness to meet project milestones, internal team needs, and customer expectations. Experience managing projects in the healthcare industry is a plus. Project Management Professional (PMP) certification a plus. 

Where:

The EverCommerce team is distributed globally, with teams in the U.S., Canada, the U.K., Jordan, New Zealand, and Australia. With a widely distributed team, we are used to working remotely across different time zones. This role can be based anywhere in the United States – if you’re close to one of our offices, we can set you up in-office or you can work 100% remotely. Please note that you must be eligible to work without sponsorship to qualify for this position, and this role may require travel to our Corporate Headquarters in Denver, Colorado, or to other office locations around North America.

Bachelor’s preferred degree or equivalent professional sales experience1+ years of sales experience; requisite comparable experience as deemed appropriate by PatientPoint; ideal candidate can provide goals and how they reached those goals consistently.Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook

Experience selling into provider medical practices is desiredExperience in using Salesforce.com is preferred

An entrepreneurial “own the business” work ethic is criticalPersuasive—A convincing communicator and presenterSelf-Starter—Excels working independentlyHighly Organized— Effective time management, organization and multi-tasking skills.Goal Oriented—Possesses a winning competitive spiritResourceful—Clever, industrious and adapts quicklySelf-Assured—Exhibits and inspires confidenceIntegrity – Provides accurate information to customers and corporate personnelStrong Communicator – Exhibits very strong verbal and written communication skillsPositive “Can Do” AttitudeProfessional – we are presenting to Doctors, Hospital marketers and Medical professionals and a demeanor of professionalism, diplomacy, sensitivity, and tact is keyTeam Player – must be able to collaborate with other employees on projects


#NAS

We know you bring your whole self to work every day. That is why we are committed to providing modernized benefits and cultural perks to our teammates. PatientPoint® is a leading digital health company that connects patients, healthcare providers and life sciences companies with the right information in the moments care decisions are made. Our solutions are proven to influence patient behavior and improve health outcomes, driving value for all stakeholders. Presentation skills to effectively provide status to internal executive management and customers. Job Description

Our Support Functions deliver services and make recommendations about ways to enhance our workplace and the culture of our organization. Our Support Functions include HR, Finance, Information Technology, Legal, Procurement, Administration, Facilities and Security.

The Large Molecule Operations Sourcing Associate Director in Global Operations Sourcing Procurement supports the sourcing and contracting of large molecules from commercialization through post NDA launch.

The selected candidate will be responsible for the overall sourcing strategies supporting the large molecule category. In addition, they will be developing and implementing procurement strategy, Global Category Management, contract management, risk management, stakeholder management, and supplier value management within this category.

Developing and maintaining strong relationships with key leaders and stakeholders, namely Commercialization, External Manufacturing, Quality, Regulatory, Supply Chain, Finance, Legal, Shared Business Services, and other corporate functions.

Primary Activities Include, But Are Not Limited To

Leadership -

As a supplier and sourcing lead, the selected candidate must be accountable for development and implementation of robust sourcing strategies that link to core business deliverables while leveraging the marketplace and supplier community. Delivers exemplary results in the right way. Partners with stakeholders outside of Procurement to ensure alignment.

Category scope -

Direct responsibility for supplier relationships around the world and is worldwide point of contact for global relationships with numerous key suppliers, which are complex to manage.

Sourcing Management -

Utilize, drive sourcing management as a structured process including obtaining sponsorship creating and leading cross-functional teams. Upon receiving approval for sourcing strategies, oversee/execute sourcing levers (including but not limited to RFx, negotiations, contracting activities) to ensure appropriate sourcing rigor. 

Strategy Development/Implementation -

Create breakthrough strategies which deliver quick wins and generate legitimate business value. Drive innovation.

Change Management -

Adopt high quality change practices with customers and stakeholders, building and implementing an organization which is sustainable.Be a leader by example and practice, embodying our Company's Leadership Standards.

Continuous Improvement -

Ensure that every supplier relationship is established with intent of future continuous improvement, and to lead and manage the measurement and review process to ensure delivery of expectations.

Stakeholder Management -

Work in a way that positively engages the support of business colleagues using problem solving, transparency, and proactive communication skills. Build sourcing management pipeline, ensuring stakeholder alignment and compliance to supply management processes.

Diversity -

Actively support diversity, both within our Company as well as expanding relationships and spend with Diverse Suppliers.

Must have keen insight and understanding of business requirements on a 1/3/5-year horizon, and partners GP and business peers to drive cost reductions.Implement Supplier Value Management with the key suppliers in this category to foster innovation, manage supplier performance, establish appropriate governance model, and ensure continuous improvement.

Qualifications And Experience

Education Minimum Requirement: 

Required: Undergraduate degree required. Technical or scientific degrees such as chemical engineering, chemistry, biology required. Business administration as an additional degree preferred.

Minimum of five years’ experience in the Pharma Industry,Minimum three years of in Direct GMP Materials Procurement supporting External Manufacturing.

Understanding the GMP manufacturing environment, various technologies, costing, supply chain and operational management. Negotiations, stakeholder management, financial acumen.Direct experience in a GMP manufacturing environment and deep understanding of technology complexity versus cost.

Our Sourcing team partner with the business to ensure efficient acquisition of goods and services that enables the

commercialization of our medicines, vaccines and Animal Health products. We collaborate internationally and are grouped

into center-led categories and regional operating teams.

The Company

Our company has had a presence in Switzerland since 1963. With a regional office and manufacturing/packaging facility, Lucerne is considered the center of operations. Approximately 1,000 people work collaboratively at the four Lucerne locations (Tribschenstrasse, Citybay, Schachen and Kriens). A fifth location has been recently established in Zurich, aimed at accelerating the development and commercialization of many of our company’s medicines and vaccines, which supports our mission to save and improve lives around the world. The new location has a target date of 2021 for operational readiness. We are proud to be certified as a “Top Employer Switzerland” and “Top Employer Europe” showing the company’s commitment to our employees and the community around us.

Our Tribschenstrasse office, located in the city of Luzern has a rich diversity of employees at this location including Global

Supply Chain Management, Regional External Manufacturing and one of our European Finance Hubs. The site also serves as

our regional and local headquarters for our company’s Animal Health Division in Switzerland.

Who We Are …

We are known as Merck & Co., Inc., Rahway, New Jersey, USA in the United States and Canada and MSD everywhere else. For more than a century, we have been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, our company continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world.

What We Look For …

Imagine getting up in the morning for a job as important as helping to save and improve lives around the world. Here, you have that opportunity. You can put your empathy, creativity, digital mastery, or scientific genius to work in collaboration with a diverse group of colleagues who pursue and bring hope to countless people who are battling some of the most challenging diseases of our time. Our team is constantly evolving, so if you are among the intellectually curious, join us—and start making your impact today.

We are proud to be a company that embraces the value of bringing diverse, talented, and committed people together. description:

Your role
Are you a problem solver? Do you have strong analytical skills?

 take an active, leadership role in the conflict clearance and business selection process identify and resolve complex issues arising during the conflict check process while managing deal teams’ expectations around outcome and turnaround time provide and manage reporting requirements lead strategic projects (e.g., enhanced automation and streamlining of processes, banker training, etc.) work closely with Compliance and Operational Risk Control on audit and regulatory issues and responses generate new ideas and creative approaches that help push the business forward make sound and balanced judgments (and always within professional, ethical, regulatory and legal standards) motivate and inspire others by providing a vision of shared goals train, mentor and develop the junior members of the team

Your team

We are a global team, based in New York, London and Hong Kong that interacts on a daily basis with investment bankers as well as with various support and control functions (including Legal, Compliance, Operations, Risk, Onboarding, FinCrime, Sanctions, and ESR, amongst others).

 A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field or the equivalent. Continuous learning, as defined by the Company’s learning philosophy. Experience working cross-functionally with various teams. This will be critical to success in this role. Team player who is delivery-oriented and takes responsibility for the team’s success. Enthusiastic, can-do attitude with the drive to continually learn and improve. Highly self-motivated, creative and able to dive deep in problem solving.

 A CSSLP certification and ISC2 certification preferred. Familiarity with AppSec tools such as Veracode, JFrog, X-Ray, JFrog Artifactory, SonarQube, SonarCloud and SonarLint.

title: Infrastructure Strategy & Operations Associate
description:

Forward was founded in January 2016 by former executives and engineering leaders from Google and Uber. description:
Job Description

Translational Molecular Biomarkers (TMB) is responsible for translating preclinical molecular biomarkers to clinical development across all therapeutic areas and all phases of clinical development at our company's Research laboratories. TMB laboratories leverage a diverse array of technologies to develop biomarker assays to help confirm engagement of therapeutic targets, understand mechanisms drug action, and patient response.

The Flow Cytometry group within the TMB organization is seeking a highly motivated candidate to join our team. The individual will play a critical role in the development and validation of flow cytometric assays that are deployed in support of clinical trials. The candidate for this Associate Principal Scientist position should have strong technical and biological-area expertise in flow cytometry, immunology, oncology, cell biology, and molecular biology. The candidate should also have a strong interest in lab-based assay work. In addition, the successful candidate should have a desire to collaborate closely with out-sourcing partners on the scientific and technical oversight of flow cytometric assays that support our pipeline.

The Individual Will Have The Following Responsibilities

Lead in the transition of biomarker flow cytometry assays from Basic Research to Clinical Development.Design, develop, and optimize flow cytometric assays for all therapeutic areas and all phases of clinical development.Provide technical guidance on fit-for-purpose assay validation.Troubleshoot assay and instrument-related issues.Serve as a subject matter expert in flow cytometry by collaborating with project teams, biomarker leaders, clinical operations, regulatory affairs, scientists, and physicians to facilitate the successful implementation of these assays and execute on biomarker strategies in clinical trials across early and late-stage clinical development.Liaise with external partners and Contract Research Organizations (CROs) to oversee the development and execution of flow cytometry assays.Write memos, final reports and publications summarizing data, and write/update lab SOPs.
Education Minimum Requirement

BS, BA, MS, or Ph.D. in a life sciences discipline (Biochemistry, Immunology, Cell Biology, or related field.)

Required Experience and Skills**: 

A minimum of 12+ (for BS or BA) or 8+ (for MS) or 5 (for PhD) years of clinical laboratory, academic laboratory, or pharmaceutical industry experience.Strong understanding of translational medicine and biomarker development.Extensive knowledge and experience in flow cytometry techniques including panel design, assay development, optimization, and validation, as well as instrument optimization, maintenance, and troubleshooting.In-depth experience in data analysis and interpretation using relevant analytical software tools (i.e. OMIQ, FlowJo, FCS Express, etc.).Proficient project management skills to effectively plan, coordinate, and prioritize activities to achieve project goals.Strong interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills.Motivated and able to work independently with strong leadership skills.Ability to execute within a matrixed organization and collaborate with cross-functional teams.

Preferred Experience And Skills

Well-versed in the latest research, industry trends, and technological advancements.Multi-color flow cytometry experience utilizing traditional and/or full spectrum cytometers (i.e. BD and Cytek flow cytometers).Designing and developing the following flow cytometry assays:ImmunophenotypingMinimal Residual Disease (MRD)Receptor OccupancyHigh-dimensional Flow CytometryTILsPhospho-signalingIntracellular Cytokine ProfilingCellular ProliferationExperience working with Contract Research Organizations (CROs) and possess strong skills in clear communication, detailed protocol transfer, quality agreements, regular updates, secure data transfer, regulatory compliance, and effective collaboration.Handling primary cells derived from human tissues.Primary cell isolation techniques such as tissue dissociation, density gradient centrifugation, magnetic bead separation, and/or fluorescence-activated cell sorting (FACS).Establishing and maintaining cell cultures.Performing in vitro/ex vivo differentiation and stimulation functional assays.Providing training and mentorship.

Trident Seafoods is the largest vertically integrated seafood harvesting and processing company in North America. Summary: The Manager, Environmental Health and Safety will be responsible for partnering with operations, maintenance, and support staff. Maintains training records.Ensures safety compliance by overseeing Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) and Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) regulatory shifts other regulatory related activities and procedures.Establishes, tracks, and delivers workers’ compensation cost reduction and containment practices and procedures.Plans and directs safety and industrial hygiene services and monitors third-party administration of the Workers Compensation program.Ensures Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) are in place and followed during release of or exposure to hazardous waste and/or pollutants.Maintains documentation for regulatory and company compliance.Leads or monitors safety committee meetings, and related activities.Acts as the EHS Pillar owner and is responsible for workstream pace and completion.Manages annual Trident Internal Safety audits, Tabletop and Drill activities.Provides support during OSHA, EPA, PSM, and other regulatory audits.Defines and prioritizes site programs to meet the needs of regulatory compliance, risk analysis recommendations, corporate policies and site-specific procedures and audit findings. Setting priorities, completing performance reviews, providing guidance, direction, coaching and feedback.

Acquires knowledge of Trident’s Environmental and Safety Policies by completing required training programs and performing designated work activities in accordance with training and procedures/work instructions Notifies designated personnel of any environmental or safety incidents or risks not previously documented, in accordance with Environmental Awareness and/or safety trainings.

Trident Seafoods offers a comprehensive and quality benefits package. Full time employees may be eligible for discretionary/performance-based incentives, medical, dental and vision insurance plans, optional HRA/HSA, telemedicine, employee assistance and wellness programs, long-term disability, basic life and AD&D, and 401(k) with a company match, vacation, sick time, 10 paid holidays each year, and paid parental leave. title: Lead Product Manager
description:

Defines multiple large, cross-functional and/or highly complex products, often spanning multiple product groups, and identifies gaps and customer needs by creating vision, strategy and requirements documents for products; utilizing available studies (market research, internal) and competitive analysis to identify customer needs; performing experiments to uncover additional customer value; and partnering with the business to define product roadmaps and to establish the product vision. Develops and manages the product roadmap, demonstrating expertise at the product group level, building partnerships with relevant stakeholder teams, and making trade-off decisions for multiple products or product groups. Leads the product planning process across one or more product groups by overseeing the development of requirements documents (user stories with acceptance criteria, use cases) for products or product releases; working closely with UX to oversee the design of the user experience across product group(s); monitoring release goals, prioritization, implementation, and iteration plans for one more product groups; and resolving problems that are escalated. Manages scaled launches, sometimes of multiple complex products, in collaboration with leadership. Tracks and reports on product launch metrics, utilizing feedback to drive associated actions and product iteration; contributes to post-launch reviews and drives incorporation of feedback in future product releases. Represents team in product group-level discussions with internal and external stakeholders; uses data analysis to address complex and ambiguous problems that often involve multiple stakeholder teams and span products or product groups. Works with relevant internal and external stakeholders to identify and prioritize customer issues and customer experience gaps across one or more product groups; uses findings to determine short and medium-term risk and opportunities for the product group(s) and drive further customer adoption. Provides coaching and guidance to more junior level product management team members.

 5 years of experience in: Developing product and program roadmaps with insights from customers, business partners, market research and competitive analysis; and Driving product delivery execution with software engineering and technology teams in two or more roles: Business Analyst, Product Owner and Product Manager.  4 years of experience in designing and implementing enterprise software solutions in two or more areas: Supply chain planning, Demand Planning, Inventory Management solutions, Order to Cash, Procure to Pay, Order Intake, Order Management or Order Selection.  3 years of experience in: Agile software development environment, utilizing Agile methodologies such as Scrum and Kanban to deliver high-quality software products on schedule and within budget along with ability to lead cross-functional teams in Agile environments, including facilitating sprint planning, daily stand-ups, retrospectives, and demos; Data visualization using software solutions such as Power BI, Tableau, Excel, SQL, data modeling, and data mining, including the ability to extract insights from complex data sets and communicate findings to stakeholders; Partner with IT architects and Data Analytics Partners across various group to develop technology solution architecture and driving technical strategy discussions; Implementing large scale enterprise software systems such as Oracle and SAP; Software integration and data management, including experience in leading system integration and user acceptance testing; and Managing product life cycle in project managements tools such as MS Projects, Jira or Azure VSTS.
